ca.mcgill.ecse211.main

Class RingRetriever

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.main.RingRetriever

  • public class RingRetriever
extends java.lang.Object

    ECSE 211 - Design Principles and Methods

    Author:
    Eliott Bourachot

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void fillGlobalData(java.util.Map data) 
      void findRings()
      This method finds the rings on the tree and detects their colors The colors are each associated with a value, with orange being worth the most
      static double[] getTunnelEntrancePoint(double curposx, double curposy, int tunnelLLx, int tunnelLLy, int tunnelURx, int tunnelURy)
      Returns the coordinates of the "entrance of the tunnel".
      void loadRing()
      This method loads the rings into the basket section of the robot This is done by raising the arms of the robot using the medium motor and taking the rings off the tree The way of retrieving the rings is different depending if the ring is on the lower branch or the upper branch The angle that the arms move towards the tree differs depending on the position of the ring
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method initializes the odometer class and starts the thread It also initializes the ultrasonic sensors and uses a filter to reduce the fluctuations
      void unloadRing()
      This method unloads the rings from the robot It will only be called when the robot is back in its home area The unloading of the rings will be done using a medium motor The motor will lower the back wall of the basket, then the robot will move back and forth until the rings are unloaded

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws OdometerExceptions
        This method initializes the odometer class and starts the thread It also initializes the ultrasonic sensors and uses a filter to reduce the fluctuations
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • fillGlobalData

        public static void fillGlobalData(java.util.Map data)

      • getTunnelEntrancePoint

        public static double[] getTunnelEntrancePoint(double curposx,
                                              double curposy,
                                              int tunnelLLx,
                                              int tunnelLLy,
                                              int tunnelURx,
                                              int tunnelURy)
        Returns the coordinates of the "entrance of the tunnel". This is defined as the point in the middle of the square in front of the tunnel such that there remains a black line between the point and the tunnel. We will use this black line to correct our orientation before entering the tunnel.
        Parameters:
        tunnelLLx -
        tunnelLLy -
        tunnelURx -
        tunnelURy -
        Returns:
        coordinates of entrance in tiles (not cm)

      • findRings

        public void findRings()
        This method finds the rings on the tree and detects their colors The colors are each associated with a value, with orange being worth the most

      • loadRing

        public void loadRing()
        This method loads the rings into the basket section of the robot This is done by raising the arms of the robot using the medium motor and taking the rings off the tree The way of retrieving the rings is different depending if the ring is on the lower branch or the upper branch The angle that the arms move towards the tree differs depending on the position of the ring

      • unloadRing

        public void unloadRing()
        This method unloads the rings from the robot It will only be called when the robot is back in its home area The unloading of the rings will be done using a medium motor The motor will lower the back wall of the basket, then the robot will move back and forth until the rings are unloaded
